title: Can @Riot give us a straight answer on why they can't make the Butcher's Bridge a permanent map?
body: I just don't understand, the map had absolutely no bugs when it got released nor any problems that could break the game, so why? It's not as if league had too much maps...

Riot's Spaghetti code is still a thing? Heh, I tought they got rid of it about one or two seasons ago :/

>"99 problems with my code on the wall, 99 problems with my code, take one down, patch it around, 297 problems with my code on the wall."

Current client bugs:
_Ignoring that the new client is still in Beta and thus the current [reconnect problem](http://status.leagueoflegends.com/?en_PL#eune) is irrelevant (the new client also wasn't available 1-2 seasons ago)..._
-I still randomly get thrown to the Custom Game lobby when clicking "Play again" after a game in the legacy client.

-Also with the legacy client: Summoner Profile button randomly stops working for no reason.

Ingame bugs:
-I had apparently "0/1326 HP" as Sona just after respawning (27.11-2016). 

-Turret target laser still targeting something way across the map (18.10-2016).

So yeah, the spaghetti code issue is still most definitely with us.

General bugs:
LoL is the only game I have encountered which occasionally breaks an internet connection. It really is THAT poorly coded.
_Only other program I have ever encountered that does that: NetLimiter, when it is started. But at least that one is logical because it injects itself into the network connection. Haven't used it for years, so I dunno how that one is now._

LoL runs on the obsolete UDP protocol. _There_ is a bug for you.

UDP is no more obsolete than TCP, and in fact quite a lot of critical network infrastructure runs on UDP (including almost every routing protocol that isn't at layer 2 (which your network connection depends on), all network time synchronization protocols (which you're almost certainly using), many logging protocols, DHCP (which you almost certainly use daily), DNS (which you do use daily), many VPN protocols, a number of VoIP protocols, and a majority of infrastructure management protocols (which you indirectly depend on because of your ISP depending on them)).

They were in the process of rewriting/revising code. Pretty recently (like a few patches ago) they completely rewrote the code for Master Yi's Alpha Strike, so I'm guessing they're still unspaghetting the codes.

I think it would be really cool if the map skins for ARAM were also random. It would be in the spirit of the game mode, and would add even more variety by switching up announcers and maps from time to time. I'm not sure how technically difficult that would be, but at least Riot would have all the assets already. On top of that, Riot could even throw in the old Proving Grounds as an ultra-rare random map skin.

Probably just a priority thing. They're putting most of their efforts towards getting the new client fully functioning and stable, so new features come later. All the assets are there, it's most likely just a matter of hooking the client up so it will randomly select one of the map skins.
